title: Wire Resume download button to backend-served PDF route

requirements.summary: Update the ResumeDownloadButton to check and download the resume from the backend HTTP download route instead of the bundled /assets PDF, while preserving existing loading/disabled states and English button text.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the "Download Resume" button triggers a direct browser download of the PDF served by the backend route.
The availability check (HEAD) targets the backend download route and correctly disables the button when the backend route is unavailable/non-200.
All user-facing button text remains in English (e.g., "Download Resume", "Loading...", "Resume Unavailable").

file_operations.description: Replace the hardcoded /assets/resume/... PDF path with the backend HTTP download route path constant, and ensure the rendered <a> uses that backend route URL so clicking triggers a direct browser download while keeping the same Loading/Unavailable/Download button states and English labels.

Ensure the HEAD availability check is used against the backend resume download route (passed in as the hook argument) and continues to treat any non-2xx response as unavailable so the button remains disabled when the backend route is missing or returns non-200.
